objects.name: Acquire or compromise 3rd party signing certificates
objects.description: Code signing is the process of digitally signing executables or scripts to confirm the software author and guarantee that the code has not been altered or corrupted. Users may trust a signed piece of code more than an signed piece of code even if they don't know who issued the certificate or who the author is. (Citation: Adobe Code Signing Cert)

external_references.description: Brad Arkin. (2012, September 27). Inappropriate Use of Adobe Code Signing Certificate. Retrieved March 28, 2017.
